column1: 2 ^ Vōce meā ad Dominum clāmāvī; vōce meā ad Deum
column2: et intendit mihī. ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice; to God with my voice
column3: and he gave ear to me.

column1: 3 ^ In diē trībulātiōnis meae Deum exquīsīvī
column3: et nōn sum dēceptus; renuit consōlārī anima mea. ^ In the days of my trouble I sought God
column4: with my hands lifted up to him in the night
column5: and I was not deceived; my soul refused to be comforted.

column1: 4 ^ Memor fuī Deī
column4: et dēfēcit spīritus meus. ^ I remembered God

column1: 5 ^ Anticipāvērunt vigiliās oculī meī; turbātus sum
column2: et nōn sum locūtus. ^ My eyes prevented the watches; I was troubled

column1: 6 ^ Cōgitāvī diēs antīquōs
column2: et annōs aeternōs in mente habuī
column3: ^ I thought upon the days of old
column4: and I had in my mind the eternal years.

column1: 7 ^ Et meditātus sum nocte cum corde meō
column3: et scopēbam spīritum meum. ^ And I meditated in the night with my own heart
column4: and I was exercised and I swept my spirit.

column1: 8 ^ ¿Numquid in aeternum prōjiciet Deus
column2: et nōn appōnet ut complacitior sit adhūc? ^ Will God then cast off for ever
column3: and will he never be more favourable again?

column1: 9 ^ ¿Aut in fīnem misericordiam suam abscindet
column2: ā generātiōne in generātiōnem? ^ Or will he cut off his mercy for ever

column1: 10 ^ ¿Aut oblīvīscētur miserērī Deus? ¿Aut continēbit in īrā suā misericordiās suās? ^ Or will God forget to show mercy? Or will he in his anger shut up his mercies?
11 ^ Et dīxī
column2: « Nunc coepī; haec mūtātiō dexterae Excelsī. » ^ And I said
column3: "Now have I begun; this is the change of the right hand of the most High."

column1: 12 ^ Memor fuī operum Dominī
column2: quia memor erō ab initiō mīrābilium tuōrum
column3: ^ I remembered the works of the Lord
column4: for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.

column1: 13 ^ et meditābor in omnibus operibus tuīs
column2: et in adinventiōnibus tuīs exercēbor. ^ And I will meditate on all thy works
column3: and will be employed in thy inventions.

column1: 14 ^ Deus
column2: in sānctō via tua; ¿quis Deus magnus sīcut Deus noster? ^ Thy way
column4: is in the holy place; who is the great God like our God?

column1: 15 ^ Tū es Deus quī facis mīrābilia; nōtam fēcistī in populīs virtūtem tuam. ^ Thou art the God that dost wonders; thou hast made thy power known among the nations.
16 ^ Redēmistī in bracchiō tuō populum tuum
column2: fīliōs Jācōbis et Jōsēfī. ^ With thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people
column3: the children of Jacob and of Joseph.

column1: 17 ^ Vīdērunt tē aquae
column4: et turbātae sunt abissī. ^ The waters saw thee
column5: O God; the waters saw thee

column1: 18 ^ Multitūdō sonitūs aquārum; vōcem dedērunt nūbēs
column2: etenim sagittae tuae transiunt. ^ Great are the roarings of the waters; the clouds sent out a sound

column1: 19 ^ Vōx tonitruī tuī in rotā; illūxērunt coruscātiōnēs tuae orbī terrae; commōta est
column2: et contremuit terra. ^ The voice of thy thunder in a wheel; thy lightnings enlightened the world; the earth shook and trembled.

column1: 20 ^ In marī via tua
column2: et sēmitae tuae in aquīs multīs
column3: et vestīgia tua nōn cognōscentur. ^ Thy way is in the sea
column4: and thy paths in many waters
column5: and thy footsteps shall not be known.

column1: 21 ^ Dēdūxistī sīcut ovēs populum tuum
column2: in manū Mōsis et Aarōnis. ^ Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep
column3: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
